column2: AZ DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Arizona
column6: AZ

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Warning signs (diamond)
column6: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
column8: Railroad advance warning signs (round)

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column6: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column8: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.

column2: 3. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: No one.
column6: The other driver.
column8: You.

column2: 4. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column6: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 5. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Stop.
column6: Construction warning.
column8: Railroad crossing.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Do not enter
column6: Lane ends
column8: No left turn

column2: 7. Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
column4: 0.15% or more.
column6: 0.08% or more.
column8: any amount.

column2: 8. At night, when approaching a car from behind, you should lower your high beam headlights when you are within ____ feet.
9. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
column6: honk your horn and proceed with caution.
column8: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.

column2: 10. A curb painted red means:
column4: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off
column6: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.
column8: No parking or stopping

column2: 11. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.
column6: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column8: The other answers are both correct.

column2: 12. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: cut abruptly in front of it.
column6: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column8: delay near it.

column2: 13. Always driving slower than other traffic:
column4: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.
column6: is a good defensive driving technique.
column8: can block traffic.

column2: 14. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column6: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 15. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the right lane ends.
column6: the road ahead is narrow.
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 16. When the traffic light is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, drivers should:
column4: honk their horn to establish their right-of-way.
column6: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
column8: not enter the intersection until they can get completely across.

column2: 17. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 18. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column6: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 19. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
column6: you must do it.
column8: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 20. When driving on the freeway behind large trucks, you should:
column4: drive closer behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle.
column6: move to the right of the truck and pass it quickly.
column8: increase your following distance.

column2: 21. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from the left.
column6: vehicles from both directions.
column8: vehicles from the right.

column2: 22. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 23. Collisions can happen more often when:
column4: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.
column6: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.
column8: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.

column2: 24. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver on the left.
column6: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.
column8: The last driver to reach the intersection.

column2: 25. When a pedestrian carrying a white cane is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you, before making your right turn, you should:
column4: yield the right-of-way and wait until the pedestrian crosses the street.
column6: turn off the ignition until the person crosses the street.
column8: use your horn to help the pedestrian cross the street.

column2: 26. Which statement about driving and drugs is true?
column4: Only illegals drugs can impair your driving.
column6: Prescription drugs are safe to use if they don't make you feel drowsy.
column8: Even over the counter drugs can impair your driving.

column2: 27. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column6: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 28. Blocking an intersection during rush hour traffic is not permitted:
column4: unless you have the right-of-way.
column6: unless you entered the intersection on a green light.
column8: under any circumstances.

column2: 29. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column6: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column8: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.

column2: 30. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.
column6: obey signals from crossing guards.
column8: All of the above.
